text: Doug Lionel Sax (April 26, 1936 - April 2, 2015) was an American mastering engineer from Los Angeles, California. He helped create three of The Doors' albums, including their 1967 debut; six of Pink Floyd's albums, including The Wall; Ray Charles' multiple-Grammy winner Genius Loves Company in 2004, and Bob Dylan's 36th studio album Shadows in the Night in 2015. Sax died on April 2, 2015, at the age of 78 from cancer in Los Angeles.Legendary Mastering Engineer Doug Sax Has Passed Away ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1936 births Category:2015 deaths Category:Engineers from California Category:Cancer deaths in Los Angeles Category:American Grammy Award winners Category:People from Los Angeles
title: Doug Sax
